intro: Symplocos rufescens, commonly known as the red-fruited wax myrtle, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by orange to red berries that are edible for some bird species. Symplocos rufescens thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
